section.name: description
section.description: The hfm CLI allows you to upload and download files as streams and to otherwise manipulate remote files as if they were local files.

command.name: cp
command.description: The hfm cp command kicks off upload or download of data streams.

section.name: name
section.description: hfm cp - upload or download data streams

section.name: description
section.description: The "cp" command takes uploads or downloads a data stream.

section.name: examples
section.description: cat test.mov | pv -s 3846487146 | hfm cp --local\nhfm cp --remote | pv -s 41115648 > hello.txt

option.name: --local
option.description: Allows you to upload a file from a local input stream (e.g. STDIN), to the server.

option.name: --remote
option.description: Allows you to download a file from the server, to a local output stream (e.g. STDOUT).
